metadata.title: CVE-2023-50269 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Squid is a caching proxy for the Web. Due to an Uncontrolled Recursion bugin versions 2.6 through 2.7.STABLE9, versions 3.1 through 5.9, and versions6.0.1 through 6.5, Squid may be vulnerable to a Denial of Service attackagainst HTTP Request parsing. This problem allows a remote client toperform Denial of Service attack by sending a large X-Forwarded-For headerwhen the follow_x_forwarded_for feature is configured. This bug is fixed bySquid version 6.6. In addition, patches addressing this problem for thestable releases can be found in Squid's patch archives.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-50269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
squid-cgi - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
squid-common - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
squid-openssl - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
squid-purge - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
squidclient - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3').
